gov.nih.nci.hl7.ui.tree
Class TreeDefaultDropTransferHandler

java.lang.Object
  gov.nih.nci.hl7.ui.tree.TreeDefaultDropTransferHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
HL7SDKDropCompatibleComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
CSVTreeDropTransferHandler, TargetTreeDropTransferHandler
public class TreeDefaultDropTransferHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements HL7SDKDropCompatibleComponent

This class provides the default implementation of drop handling on tree. Please override corresponding method to provide more complex handlings.

Version:
Since caAdapter v1.2 revision $Revision: 1.1 $ date $Date: 2006-10-03 17:36:25 $
Author:
OWNER: Scott Jiang, LAST UPDATE $Author: marwahah $

RCSID

public static java.lang.String RCSID
String that identifies the class version and solves the serial version UID problem. This String is for informational purposes only and MUST not be made final.

See Also:
JBuilder vice javac serial version UID

isDropOk

public boolean isDropOk(java.awt.dnd.DropTargetDragEvent e)
Called by the DropTargetAdapter in dragEnter, dragOver and dragActionChanged descendant class shall override this function, since current implementation if the node is a leaf, the drop is NOT OK; otherwise, it is OK;

Specified by:
isDropOk in interface HL7SDKDropCompatibleComponent
Returns:
if drop is OK.

Called by the DropTargetAdapter in drop return true if add action succeeded otherwise return false

Specified by:
setDropData in interface HL7SDKDropCompatibleComponent

setInDragDropMode

public void setInDragDropMode(boolean flag)
Because when a drag is over a component, a selection listener would be notified as if there were an item being selected. These two function will allow DropTargetAdapter to notify the selection listener(s) of the drop target component if the drag comes or the actual selection occurs

Specified by:
setInDragDropMode in interface HL7SDKDropCompatibleComponent

public boolean isInDragDropMode()
